description:
In Dominican Republic in March 17 new measures regarding closure of schools were taken.Teaching was suspended in all schools and universities. In August 24 a new school reopening protocol will start. 
Some measures:
- The seats a meter and a half to its four sides separation
- Constant use of masks
- Distance between students in the hallway
- Restriction of external visits
- Registration of the temperature at the entrance, hand washing with soap and disinfection with hand sanitazer.
-Avoiding handshakes, hugs and the formation of groups to talk, entertain or play.
- The doors and windows of the classrooms must remain open during the school day so that the air inside can flow.
(Among other measures) UPDATE: In Dominican Republic in March 17 new measures regarding closure of schools were taken.Teaching was suspended in all schools and universities. In August 24 a new school reopening protocol will start.

-Avoiding handshakes, hugs and the formation of groups to talk, entertain or play.
- The doors and windows of the classrooms must remain open during the school day so that the air inside can flow.
(Among other measures)

description: The Dominican Republic is implementing a curfew from Mar. 21 until Apr. 3 between 8pm and 6 am. The only exceptions include doctors, nurses and health workers, those who need to be hospitalized, private security guards and press representatives authorized, and employees of electricity companies for emergency situations.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Dominican Republic set originally a curfew nation wide but it has been relaxed excluding people who work in food, energy and water industry, ports and airports after March 23 UPDATE: The original curfew was set nationwide but it has been relaxed excluding people who work in food industry, energy and water industry, ports and airports after March 23

The Dominican Republic "announced a curfew expansion from 5 p.m. to 6 a.m. The prior curfew, announced on March 20 by President Danilo Medina, decreed a nationwide curfew between the hours of 8 p.m. and 6 a.m. until April 3" after Mar. 26 UPDATE: on March 26, the government announced a curfew expansion from 5 p.m. to 6 a.m
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
On July 7, the Dominican Republic issued a new curfew for the country:

Monday to Friday:  10:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m., with a grace period for transit until 12:00 a.m.
Saturday and Sunday: 7:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m., with a grace period for transit until 9:00 p.m.

description:
In Dominican Republic, the curfew has been stablished again on 20 of July during 20 days from 21 of July. 

From Monday to Friday from 7:00 at night to 5:00 in the morning, and on Saturdays and Sundays from 5:00 in the afternoon to 5:00 in the morning in the geographical areas of Santo Domingo, National District, Santiago , San Cristóbal, La Vega, Puerto Plata, Duarte, San Pedro de Macorís, La Romana, San Juan de la Maguana, La Altagracia, Azua, Monsignor Nouel, Sánchez Ramírez and María Trinidad Sánchez.

description: The Dominican Republic announced that travellers no longer need to produce a negative COVID-19 test results upon arrival. Further, starting from 09 August until 27 September 2020 .the curfew is reinstated from 7:00 pm to 5:00 am from Monday through Friday and from 5:00 pm to 5:00 am on Saturdays and Sundays in Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional, Santiago, San Cristóbal, La Vega, Puerto Plata, Duarte, San Pedro de Macorís, La Romana, San Juan de la Maguana, La Altagracia, Azua, Monseñor Nouel, Sánchez Ramírez y María Trinidad Sánchez; and every day from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am in Espaillat, Peravia, Barahona, Monteplata, Valverde, Hermanas Mirabal, Monte Cristi, Samaná, Bahoruco, Hato Mayor, El Seibo, Dajabón, Santiago Rodríguez, San José de Ocoa, Elías Piña, Independencia and Pedernales.

description: "The Dominican Government announced a national state of emergency for a period of 25 days" after Mar. 17

description: The Dominican Republic " extended the nationwide state of emergency that was set to expire that day for 17 more days. The new decree, which will go into effect April 14, extends the national state of emergency Medina previously declared on March 17 and that went into effect on March 19 for a period of 25 days. Under the state of emergency, the country’s borders will remain closed, all incoming flights will be canceled, and most commercial activities and cultural activities will continue to be suspended. Grocery stores, gas stations, pharmacies, and markets will remain open." after April 13 UPDATE: The orginal state of emergency was extended for 17 more days on April 13
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
In Dominican Republic, the state of emergency has been declared again. From the 20 of July during 45 days (3rd of september)
The presidential provision, after authorization by the National Congress, establishes proportional and temporary restrictions on freedom of movement, association and assembly in accordance with the provisions of literals h) and J) of numeral 6 of article 266 of the Constitution and numerals 8 and 10 of article 11 of Law number. 21-18.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: The Dominican Republic will improve the payment of infectious medicine, internists, pulmonologists and intensivists doctors, as a result of an agreement between the Superintendency of Health and Labour Risks (Sisalril), the ARS (insurance) and the Association of Private Clinics. The raise is from 800 to 2000 Dominican pesos (from €12 to €30,5) per patient and per day. For doctors of other specialties, the raise is from 800 to 1500 Dominican pesos (around €23). This is in effect from 1st April and for 90 days.

description:
In Dominican Republic on July 15. Health resources have been developed. 
Announcement of an increase in the fees for specialist doctors who care for patients with COVID-19 in hospitalization and Intensive Care, adding Pediatricians and Obstetricians to those previously included.
The contribution for Personal Protective Equipment will also be increased to an estimated total of RD $ 247 million per month, of which the ARS will contribute RD $ 143 million pesos per month and the rest will be covered by the Social Security System and the Government

description: In Dominican Republic in April 13 new measures regarding health testing were taken. It is established that the Health Risk Administrators (ARS) will return to affiliates the total of the rate agreed between the Ministry of Public Health and private laboratories. The reimbursement applies to citizens who have paid for the test between March 18, the date of the signing of the agreement between the Ministry of Public Health and the authorized laboratories, until March 31, when the SISALRIL Resolution that authorizes the test coverage came into force.  It may even cover later dates if the ARS was unable to provide coverage for operational reasons.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In Dominican Republic new measures regarding health testing have been stablished form March 23.
2 private laboratories have been authorized to carry out virus detection tests.
Until now, it is only recommended to carry it out in the following cases, and provided that you have the proper medical prescription:
-People who have been in countries with circulation of the virus in the last 15 days or who have traveled on cruise ships.
-People who have two or more symptoms associated with the virus.
-People who have been in contact with other people infected by the virus.

description: Wearing masks is obligatory in public places and private spaces for collective use as a measure to control the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in the country.  The non-compliance will carry fines ranging from one to ten minimum rates with people who do not wear masks. From June 22. UPDATE: The original norm about the obligation of wearing masks was directed to public spaces and the enforcement was lighter. Now wearing masks is obligatory in public places and private spaces for collective use as a measure to control the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in the country.  The non-compliance will carry fines ranging from one to ten minimum rates with people who do not wear masks. From June 22.

description:
On March 13, the Dominican Republic urged citizens voting in the March 15 elections to adopt the following prevention measures: 
1. Maintain at least a one-meter distance from the person in front of you in line,
2. Cover your mouth and nose with a bent elbow or tissue when coughing and sneezing, and dispose of the tissue immediately and clean your hands with alcohol-based gel
3. Avoid touching your nose, eyes, and mouth until you have properly sanitized your hands, preferably with soap and water.
4. Avoid close contact with people who show flu-like symptoms.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
"The Dominican authorities announced further measures to contain the spread of coronavirus in the country:

   Social gatherings are prohibited in grocery stores (colmados),including the consumption of alcoholic beverages on their premises.
    A reminder to the whole population to observe the lockdown, stay at home and only leave when necessary for food, medical supplies or medical attention.
    Requested that celebrations are postponed, such as: wedding or birthdays and apply hygiene measures when leave their home, washing their hands, clothing and shoes upon returning home.
    When leaving domiciles, only one member of the family should do so and keep to social distancing standards (2 metres away from any other person)." after Mar. 23 UPDATE: On March 23 the governement announced further measures

description:
In Dominican Republic on May 17 as part of the de-escalation, new measures have been taken regarding restriction of businesses. 

The obligation of different schedules is announced, at 7 AM supermarkets, pharmacies, construction sector, industry and processing companies will begin to operate, including export processing zones. Likewise, mining and quarrying, agricultural and agroindustrial activity and activity in ports and airports will begin at that time, and they will continue to receive only freight and ferry flights.

At 8 AM, public sector employees will begin to work and at 9 AM other businesses such as hardware stores, vehicle dealers, workshops, financial sector, furniture and appliance stores, fabric and clothing stores, in addition to the service sector, would begin operating.
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the business is considered essential or non-essential

update_level_var: Volume of policy relaxing ; timing of policy relaxing
description:
In Dominican Republic, now in May 17. Mesaures regarding restriction of businesses had changed, The President of the Republic Danilo Medina announces as part of the de-escalation measures that micro-companies, which may have up to 10 employees, may work up to 5 employees or no more than 50% of the staff.
In the small ones, which are those between 10 and 50, a minimum of 10 people and no more than 50% of their employees may work. Medium and large companies must operate with a maximum of 25% of the staff in the first phase. UPDATE: The original measures in restriction of non-essential businesses set that had to close completely, no that has changed relaxing the measures.

description: In Dominican Repiblic, in March 17. Non-essential commercial activities were suspended with the exception of those that are dedicated to basic activities for the population: supermarkets, grocery stores, fuel stations, pharmacies and commercial establishments dedicated to the sale of raw or cooked food, like restaurants that will only be operative for delivery and take away services.

description:
In Dominican Republic on May 25, changes in restriction to businesses  have occured. The opening of stores in shopping centers is authorized under strict compliance with general and sectoral protocols, which include hygiene and distance measures, in addition to the maximum number of workers allowed in this first phase of de-escalation.

This decision is made with the purpose of facilitating the purchase of gifts for Mother's Day, as well as other items during the days of the week, avoiding a crowd of customers on Saturdays and Sundays.

Food, games and recreation facilities are kept closed to avoid crowds. UPDATE: The orignal restriction on non-essential businesses set that all had to close, now in May 25, stores in shopping centers can open.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 13, the Central Election Board of the Dominican Republic adopted several measures for the March 15 elections. Election officials will:

1. Streamline the mobility of voters to avoid crowds in public spaces around polling stations.
2. Prioritize in the voting process those who require it according to their physical condition as is traditionally done, but on this occasion, include people who present respiratory manifestations.
3. Facilitate that within the precincts voters stay one meter away to reduce exposure to respiratory secretions.
4. Provide the officials and delegates in the electoral precincts with the conditions for hand hygiene (washing or use of alcohol-based solution over 65%).
5. As a preventive measure, substitute officials or delegates who have fever or respiratory manifestations.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In Dominican Republic it has been stablished new measures regarding restriction and regulation of government services since March 23.
For public offices, 3 categories are established according to the priority of their activity:
- First category must completely close its doors to the public.
- Second category, they will work with the minimum of personnel and they will be able to answer queries by remote means using telework.
(Both cases, they must maintain a minimum staff necessary for basic administrative, financial and operational procedures, as well as security personnel who guarantee the integrity of the facilities)
- Third category (essential activities) will remain with normal activity
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions attached

description:
In Dominican Republic new measures regarding restriction and regulation of government services were taken since March 23.
In April 24 Ministers, directors and general administrators were summoned to join the official work from April 27, this with the minimum personnel and complying with the protocol established by the World Health Organization (WHO), the Pan American Health Organization ( PAHO) and the Ministry of Public Health regarding hygiene, social distancing and protection measures for those who go to work. UPDATE: In March 23 several government services were suspended. In April 24 new relaxing measures are taken and Ministers, directors and general administrators are summoned to join the official work from April 27, this with the minimum personnel and complying with the protocol established by the World Health Organization (WHO), the Pan American Health Organization ( PAHO) and the Ministry of Public Health regarding hygiene, social distancing and protection measures for those who go to work.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions attached

description:
In Dominican Republic it has been stablished new measures regarding restriction and regulation of government services since May 17.
The public sector will begin to work with 50% of the personnel, and the incumbents are authorized to increase this percentage if the needs so demand.

 UPDATE: The original restriction set that the non-essential governmental institutions had to close. Now in May 17, they are openning with 50% of employees.

description: The Dominican Republic announced regulations on social distancing. Public transportation will open with modified schedules, with at least 1.5 meters of separation between users and a 60% limited capacity. Social distancing of at least 6.5 feet (2 meters) and the use of face masks in public places are required for the general and traveling public within indoor spaces and in areas where social distancing is not possible. These locations include but are not limited to airport terminals, within indoor and outdoor shopping areas, while using public transportation, when seeking medical attention within a hospital or clinic, among others. Social distancing is also required at the beach, and within pool and jacuzzi areas. The maximum group size allowed is 10 people. The regulations should last until 27 September 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
